name: mincingly
content:
mincingly adverb
(WALK)
Add to word list
Add to word list
using small, delicate steps in a way that does not look natural: She walked mincingly up and down the room. They were edging their horses mincingly along the edges of the road.
More examplesFewer examplesThe injured horse appeared to be dancing mincingly on his toes. They stepped mincingly over the polished floor.He twisted his left leg rather mincingly to the beat.

mincingly adverb
(SPEAK)
in a way that is too delicate and not direct enough: She answered him in an artificial, mincingly polite voice. He spoke rather mincingly, smiling, but never moving his hands.
More examplesFewer examplesWith exquisite timing, she mincingly responded: "I never doubted that for a moment."I can explain without losing my temper, but I do not intend to speak mincingly."The agony I have endured," she said mincingly, "has been unbearable."
